title: Global Logistics Provider Teams with AI Platform to Boost Last‑Mile Delivery Performance - The Supply Chain Report News
snippet: A major international logistics operator has entered a strategic partnership with an AI‑powered logistics platform to enhance last‑mile delivery efficiency,
extractedText: A major international logistics operator has entered a strategic partnership with an AI‑powered logistics platform to enhance last‑mile delivery efficiency, strengthen service predictability and support expansion of time‑sensitive offerings. The agreement reflects a growing industry trend of using artificial intelligence to optimise complex delivery operations. YOU MAY ALSO LIKE Trucking Industry Begins Putting AI to Work Across Operations Global AI Logistics Market Set to Surge as Industry Pushes for Automation and Resilience Under the deal, the logistics company will deploy the partner’s AI‑driven orchestration and routing solutions across its last‑mile networks. The technology is designed to intelligently link disparate points in the delivery chain, improve operational visibility, and help planners optimise routes and territory assignments for couriers — all of which can increase productivity and lower costs in parcel movement. A key focus of the collaboration is the planned launch of same‑day delivery services for time‑critical shipments, made possible by the platform’s advanced routing algorithms that provide more accurate delivery windows and time‑slot options for customers. Such capabilities are increasingly important in competitive e‑commerce and express logistics markets where customer expectations for speed and transparency are high. In addition to delivery planning, the partnership includes trials of workforce and territory optimisation tools that help the carrier plan delivery zones more efficiently, boosting courier output and reducing unnecessary travel. These AI‑powered features aim to make the last mile more agile and cost‑effective while enhancing overall customer experience. The logistics operator’s investment in AI also underscores broader industry shifts toward digital transformation, predictive planning and data‑driven supply chain automation as competitive necessities rather than optional technologies. #BreakingNews #SupplyChainNews #LastMileLogistics #AIinLogistics #LogisticsInnovation
